inventory.commentary: Be sure to tag adjectival uses as 'X' - wrong part of speech.

sense.name: happen or occur again
sense.examples: Her migraines recur every two or three days. In a minority of people they recur in or near the scar of the previous treatment. We should be familiar with those motives, because they recur throughout history. 'Pre-paids' are items which recur over time, such as property taxes.

sense.name: return to in thought or speech
sense.commentary: Note: Compare carefully to Sense 1: Sense 2 can only be used in terms of cognition or speaking, not simply in terms of occurring again - in that case use Sense 1.
sense.examples: He recurred once, just before lunch, to that night when we first met at his house. She recurred to that vague ideal of duty which all virtuous Americans have. As he walked on, his words recurred to him.

sense.name: have recourse to
sense.examples: What are the preliminary findings from those countries that have most recurred to active labour market measures? Other people recurred to pragmatic arguments, but these clearly cannot resolve all disagreements in a final way.
